--- In rest-discuss@yahoogroups.com, "S. Alexander Jacobson"
<alex@v...> wrote:
> I know this is a dumb question, but I can't figure
> it out from reading RFC2616:
> 
> If I do a POST and the content of my post is not
> what the server expects (e.g. my zip code is
> missing), what code should the server return?
> 
> The closest things are 409 or 415 but they don't
> seem exactly right....
> 

403 Forbidden is probably what you want, unless the representation
POSTed is XML and is not valid against a schema you have defined (to
validate the presence of ZIP codes for example...) In that case then
400 Bad Request might be applicable.
